sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer could lead to undefined behavior or memory corruption if it points to invalid or maliciously manipulated memory.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows.

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Output buffer could be shared with Normal World, leading to potential exposure of sensitive data.

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Size parameter can be tainted, leading to potential buffer overflows or memory allocation failures.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Tainted data could be written to a shared memory buffer accessible by the Normal World.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.
